etymologies: late 16th century (as periment): perhaps an alteration of pyramid

definitions: the triangular upper part of the front of a building in classical style, typically surmounting a portico of columns.
shortDefinitions: triangular upper part of front of building in classical style

definitions: a feature similar to a pediment surmounting a door, window, front, or other part of a building in another style.
shortDefinitions: similar feature surmounting door, window, front

definitions: a broad, gently sloping expanse of rock debris extending outward from the foot of a mountain slope, especially in a desert.
shortDefinitions: broad, gently sloping expanse of rock debris extending outward from foot of mountain slope
